abstract: Republican presidential candidates and other conservative politicians are undertaking sustained, sophisticated and coordinated effort to force debate on abortion; are abandoning rhetoric that many perceived as a 'war on women,' instead emphasizing emotionally resonant ideas like joy of pregnancy and first ultrasound; strategy has so far targeted Planned Parenthood, women's health organization that receives significant funding from federal government.
lead_paragraph: Republican politicians have refined the way they are talking about pregnancy and abortion rights, crafting their words in a way they hope puts Democrats on the defensive.

headline.main: Republicans Alter Script on Abortion, Seeking to Shift Debate
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Rethinks the Way It Talks About Abortion

snippet: Republican politicians have refined the way they are talking about pregnancy and abortion rights, crafting their words in a way they hope puts Democrats on the defensive.
